website_summaries.verdict: Users appreciate the sturdy, durable construction of this attractive kayak accessory.
pros: Comes apart if it needs to be stored
Blade angle is adjustable for those who want specific control
Shaft is crafted from lightweight aluminum
Includes drip rings and curved blades
cons: Some buyers had issues with shipping

customer_reviews.title: A solid, functional paddle at a great price.
customer_reviews.text: This is a very high quality paddle for the price. It feels very solid in my hands and it really moves my kayak forward with little effort. I've seen the other reviews that say this paddle is a little heavy, but it feels just fine to me. Giving up weight is giving up strength.The paddle blades are very strong. Both the drip rings and the foam hand grips work very well. I wouldn't change a thing about this paddle. I just wish I could have gotten it with green blades to match my kayak, however Ireally do like the color it comes in though.
customer_reviews.author: Craig Wright

customer_reviews.title: light enough and better for the price than the rest.
customer_reviews.text: i have this and a pelican paddle, this is FAR BETTER. the shape moves more water and is a faster paddle. im in an advanced elements inflatable kayak that tracks OK but is still not a hard bottom kayak so anything i can do to better my time is worth it. i love this paddle and until i am ready to spend the serious money on a legit fiberglass paddle this is as good as it will get. i put a measuring sticker on mine so i can measure fish. suggested.
customer_reviews.author: Moyshe oofnik

customer_reviews.title: Damaged
customer_reviews.text: If there was a zero star, I would have rated it a Zero. Totally disappointed. Waited a week to receive this and the male section was smashed so it would NOT fit into the female connection. Useless. Before submitting this review, I straighten out the tubing with a pair of pliers, which should NOT have been needed. A pain in the a** having to return things, so I will keep it, hoping the paint does not chip off due to the damaged aluminum,
customer_reviews.author: Kay

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with this paddle
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't sure what kind of paddle I should get, so i researched online for length and type and decided on this one because of the great price. It has turned out to be durable , easy to put together and does a great job in the water.
customer_reviews.author: anitalouise

customer_reviews.title: Where Quality meets Economy.
customer_reviews.text: I really love getting on the water in my kayak, but have never really had a lot of money to throw at my hobby. That being said I've done a lot of research on paddles and have tested several. I decided on this paddle because of the price and how highly it was rated by others. The paddle is comfortable for longer trips and feels substantial. One thing that I noticed- is that the blades are well made and DO NOT buckle easily. You will notice SOME give if you use them to push off, but there is absolutely no give with harder paddling. I'd recommend this paddle to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: My Name Is Irrelevant

customer_reviews.title: Actually 84-inch paddle, but seems like a good 84-inch paddle.
customer_reviews.text: Paddle feels sturdy and price is right, but the item is a “92 inch” paddle and the packaging clearly says 84 Inch. It’s obviously shorter than I intended.
customer_reviews.author: Trevor

customer_reviews.title: Not very sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Thought this would be much sturdier than what it is. Works fine in slow moving water but if you get into any rapids whatsoever it just doesn’t seem like it would last long.
customer_reviews.author: Josh Caldwell

customer_reviews.title: Great solid paddle works better than expected
customer_reviews.text: I have a Old Town, 10 Vapor Recreational Kayak which sets high in water and this paddle does the job well. water shield work pretty good still have to not raise up end to much to keep water from coming in.. I'm left handed and read it wasn't as nice for right handed even though you have multiple angle adjustments (I think 3). Pushes my big old Kayak every where is solid and comes apart to hual easy.. love it.
customer_reviews.author: Ron Hurst

customer_reviews.title: Bought one years ago and loved it
customer_reviews.text: This is second one I have bought, who ever had this paddle could easily run away from who had standard paddle. So now there is no unfair advantage or fighting over this great paddle.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Conner

customer_reviews.title: I only do easy floats on a local river so it may not ...
customer_reviews.text: I am 53 and new to kayaking. I initially tried the cheaper paddles. Went with this one and I have not regrets. I only do easy floats on a local river so it may not work so well in more intense waters.
customer_reviews.author: Jones

customer_reviews.title: Search no more!
customer_reviews.text: This is the paddle that we fight over, when it’s time to go kayaking... because everyone in our family LOVES IT! We only have the one, and we wish that it came in other colors so that we could keep track of who they belong to. We have a family of 5.
customer_reviews.author: a record

customer_reviews.title: Durable paddle
customer_reviews.text: Durable paddle use it all the time for a kayak I’ve never had any problems with it
customer_reviews.author: ladynla78

customer_reviews.title: Nice, but more $ than it was
customer_reviews.text: This is the exact same paddle- same brand, same everything, that my husband bought for less than half the price last year. Before it was advertised as Airhead, now the Airhead one on Amazon and other sites say out of stock, but they they have the "Kwik Tek" one- however, the paddle you receive still says Airhead on it because ITS THE SAME ONE! Which is what I wanted, but I wanted it for the $15 everyone charged for it when they called it "Airhead". Other than that its a good paddle- light and good for recreational kayaking. IF it was $15 I would have given it 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: 7saturdays

customer_reviews.title: I'm a novice kayaker so am not a great paddling mind at what makes one superior to another
customer_reviews.text: I'm a novice kayaker so am not a great paddling mind at what makes one superior to another, but the paddle was fairly priced compared with what I've seen in stores and moves me from point A to Point B...I'd buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, and a nice value
customer_reviews.text: We bought these to go with an, and they are very nice and sturdy. As some others have noted, the length could be a little longer, but our kids will use them more than I will so they work well for them. I appreciate that they seem to be very well made - the handles are metal and the paddle ends are plastic but overall it feels strong - and they come apart in the middle for easier transportation in the car. They're not too heavy but they don't feel lightweight or cheap, either. A nice value.
customer_reviews.author: J. Green

customer_reviews.title: Good Paddle
customer_reviews.text: I love it so far. The handle isn't as squishy as I was hoping for, but I'm sure it's better than a paddle without the foam.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon

customer_reviews.title: Arrived in a very timely manner.
customer_reviews.text: Have not used the paddle yet b/c the weather in MO this spring SUCKS! It looks great and the red matches the kayak perfectly!
customer_reviews.author: Two Dogs

customer_reviews.title: Great value paddle
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this for my daughter and her kayak in the 230 mm; red color was a rare match and the padded handles are well made for her use. Seems well made, fits together tightly without any wobble, which some cheaper paddles have and is very annoying. Better quality than the Carlisle Daytripper in my opinion, which is really the only other paddle in the price range.
customer_reviews.author: Riversound

customer_reviews.title: Decent middle of the road kind of paddle.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to snap together. Good curve in the paddle for a smooth stroke.
customer_reviews.author: KatesFate

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good quality paddles, recommended, but, FYI, a bit heavy for anyone with hand pain issues.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I used on small river I’m a beginner and had no problems. Hand grip is great
customer_reviews.author: Ali

customer_reviews.title: seems well made.
customer_reviews.text: amateur here - - works well for us. seems well made. my wife prefers this over our other paddles. a little too short for me.
customer_reviews.author: diydiy

customer_reviews.title: Great paddle
customer_reviews.text: I got this paddle back in March, it is a little small, but so am I so we fit together pretty well. It is only two pounds, so it is light enough to move but sturdy enough to handle water, rocks, sticks and shore. I like this paddle, but I didn't realize how much I liked it until I borrowed a friends boat and paddle one weekend. They had a thin, high priced model that didn't cut the water near as clean as this cheapo paddle does. This is a great buy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Overall this is a great paddle so far
customer_reviews.text: I'm a huge guy with lots of strength. I figured this paddle would break but so far has been very satisfactory. I've had paddles that cost +$100 and performed the same as this one. The blades do flex a little when paddling but not much and not to the point that they are going to break. Of course this paddle is heavier than a fancy carbon one but it's still not heavy. The weight is kind of subjective - if you are racing or performance kayaking then you are not going to be using a $30 paddle off amazon. Overall this is a great paddle so far. I will update this at a later time.
customer_reviews.author: Stuff

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, lightweight, and Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: PROS: * Easy to assemble (snap the two paddles together) * Shaft made well of metal * Plastic paddlefins are thick plastic and light weight * Curved fin helps push water a little better * Good water blocking rings * Cushioned hand grips * Cheap price at $30 from amazon CONS: * Plastic may get brittle and broken if left in sun for months * Length could be about a foot longer, but it's highly manageable and not noticable by most Overall, I highly recommend and would purchase this again. I have two for my two person kayak. Works great.
customer_reviews.author: Jb

customer_reviews.title: Great paddle.
customer_reviews.text: Nice padded paddle. The curve makes it easier to paddle.
customer_reviews.author: JOAN

customer_reviews.title: Kayak paddle
customer_reviews.text: Haven't had a chance to use the paddle yet but seems well made
customer_reviews.author: robert hawn

customer_reviews.title: works well
customer_reviews.text: Been using for a month and no issues so far. I use my kayak for fishing, so I paddle and stop a lot. They aren't super light; it's aluminum. They are very comfortable to hold since they have foam padding for both hands. Paddle splits in 2 for easy transport or storage. Seems to be a good value for the money, especially where it comes already with foam pads. Says they will float if dropped in the water too.
customer_reviews.author: Cienna

customer_reviews.title: The spare that I use every time
customer_reviews.text: I already had a Field and Stream paddle that was given to me with my kayak. About a year ago when I got a second kayak for my son, I got this paddle from Amazon. It was about half the price of what my paddle cost at Dick's Sporting Goods, but the curved blade made it much better. A few weeks before we got the kayaks out for the year, I got another one of these on sale for a spare, and after several trips, my Field and Stream paddles have yet to leave the house.
customer_reviews.author: insomniac

customer_reviews.title: Great paddle for the money
customer_reviews.text: Great paddle for the money! It's not too much heavier than my other paddle that was 3x the price, and I like the curved paddle design.
customer_reviews.author: Glenna

customer_reviews.title: Great beginner paddle
customer_reviews.text: I bought 4 of these for kayaking. They are heavier than more expensive paddles, but that is expected. The paddle disconnects in half easily for storage. It will also float, although I did not test for a long period of time, it would definitely provide enough time to grab it if you dropped it in the water.
customer_reviews.author: motw

customer_reviews.title: Great Paddle!
customer_reviews.text: I have used one like this before my son let someone buying an extra kayak he had talk him into selling this same paddle too with the kayak. I tried a different shaped one but hated how it would not turn much water. I kayak in the river and need a paddle that can help me make quick maneuvers. This one works well for me.
customer_reviews.author: Henna

customer_reviews.title: Heavy paddle
customer_reviews.text: Paddle is heavy compared to most paddles. The blades of the paddle are poorly shaped and the shape just doesn’t cut through the water smoothly. This product was well made, but just isn’t a good paddle for kayaking.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: Works as it should for a very affordable price. I live and use it in Mexico where "I tend to missplace items" hahha. Great for the price.
customer_reviews.author: PRB

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight, Functional, Easy To Use, Tote, and Store
customer_reviews.text: I got these kayak paddles to go with my Sevylor Inflatable Canoe because they are lightweight, easy to use, easy to tote around, and easy to store in a storage bin of my motorhome. Why am I using kayak paddles in a canoe? So that I don't have to switch paddles back and forth and so that my husband and I don't inadvertently smack each other in the head. These are nice, functional kayak paddles and work very well with my inflatable canoe.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca

customer_reviews.title: A little heavy
customer_reviews.text: I don't mind that it weighs almost twice the weight of its competitors, but keep that in mind when ordering. I really like the curved paddles. If I had noticed the weight issue, would have went with a different paddles. Good buy for the money though.
customer_reviews.author: Eddie

customer_reviews.title: Kwik Tek Deluxe paddle
customer_reviews.text: The paddle is relatively light. The adjustments available to set paddle for flat or diagonal blade positions is nice. It breaks down into two pieces which will fit into the rear storage compartment of my kayak which is very handy. So far I'm very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Paddles are a little shorter than others that I have ...
customer_reviews.text: Paddles are a little shorter than others that I have used, but they work perfectly for my small 1 person kayak
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Charles Pasch

customer_reviews.title: Quality kayak paddle!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble, lightweight but sturdy, it's a great paddle especially for the price!
customer_reviews.author: laffer14

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great paddle and great price, compared to a west marine or something
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Much better paddle than the higher dollar ones at the sporting ...
customer_reviews.text: Much better paddle than the higher dollar ones at the sporting goods stores for half the price! Feels sturdy, comes apart easily, love the foam grips!
customer_reviews.author: Jenny Scott

customer_reviews.title: I broke my Dad's paddle
customer_reviews.text: I broke my Dad's paddle trying to splash him a little too enthusiastically and this replaced it. Lovely color and from from what I hear a very smooth stroke. Next time I'm at his lake house I'll see if it breaks with spirited use and update the review.
customer_reviews.author: Roger Cunningham

customer_reviews.title: best paddle I own
customer_reviews.text: I have about 6 different paddles, this is my newest annd my new favorite Lightweight, large surface area, well shaped
customer_reviews.author: Val D.

customer_reviews.title: scoops lots of h2o but quite heaby
customer_reviews.text: scoops lots of h2o but quite a heavy paddle. the packaging was ok, but maybe could have been bubble wrapped to protect in the truck. works well for rivers and kids. it can really turn kayak on a dime
customer_reviews.author: maddy

customer_reviews.title: Great Blade.
customer_reviews.text: You cannot beat this blade for the price paid. We have used it for two years now and it is showing its durability. We looked at tohers for 2-3 times as much but are quite happy with this model.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Worked way better than a more expensive brand I had purchased,.
customer_reviews.author: Teresa

customer_reviews.title: Good quality!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great paddle for the price. I like it better than my $50 field and stream chute paddle.
customer_reviews.author: Edwin Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Good quality and price just they should note that paddle is pink
customer_reviews.text: Paddle is nice cushion grips are great but pictures show a orange paddle and the one I received is pink
customer_reviews.author: samuel

customer_reviews.title: These paddles were well-made, but too short for the ...
customer_reviews.text: These paddles were well-made, but too short for the width of the Airhead Montana Kayak. No issue recommending them if you know you want an 84" paddle.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa & Adam

customer_reviews.title: Bought to use with our new Kayaks. For the ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought to use with our new Kayaks. For the money they are worthwhile since we are just recreational users and did not want to put a lot of money into these.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra W Austin

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works great for the money. Have noticed minor rusting on connection points, but nothing that interferes with functionality.
customer_reviews.author: Neonoah

customer_reviews.title: Paddle too short for emotion kayak
customer_reviews.text: The paddle is made well but is too short for the Emotion Glide kayaks we purchased. The Glide kayak is a sit in type with fairly high gunwales. This means you have to hold the paddle very high and at a large angle to reach the water. Both my wife and high found this to be very tiring. I extended both our paddles to 96" with aircraft aluminum tubing and they now work well. We also found that we could only use the paddle with the blades vertical. The other position places the blades at a wierd, unusable angle.
customer_reviews.author: David J. Bezinque

customer_reviews.title: great for the price
customer_reviews.text: great for the price this was purchased for kids use! Looks vary stylish/trendy. Much lighter weight than most other paddles in the cheap price range. yes the paddle is shorter than advertized but for the kids who cares!
customer_reviews.author: Andrew W. Weigl

customer_reviews.title: Bit expensive, but not too bad
customer_reviews.text: This paddle is shorter then advertised, but it suited my needs well enough. Pros: Foam grips are comfy Water catcher a nice touch Looks and feels durable enough Cons: Shorter then Advertised A bit expensive, this used to be 20 the button connecting the two sections might be a tad flimsy, but thats nothing. Overall, not too bad a paddle, I recommend investing in a bit higher priced one, even for beginners
customer_reviews.author: Joe The Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very Sturdy Adjustable Paddle
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy and due to the color of the paddles, it's easy to find me out on the lake. Very timely shipping. Like the product.
customer_reviews.author: 2000RS

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: I can't seem to get the paddles to offset correctly! It is comfy, but way too heavy for me.
customer_reviews.author: Henny Penny

customer_reviews.title: Buy this don't spend $80 at an outdoors store for an inferior produce
customer_reviews.text: Got this as a replacement paddle and fell in love. The foam grips help tremendously when doing long trips(kayaked 6 hours no blisters)
customer_reviews.author: Cal

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: Pours water all over you where other paddles merely drip.
customer_reviews.author: Angie F

customer_reviews.title: ... it for the first time today and was not disappointed. Great paddle
customer_reviews.text: Used it for the first time today and was not disappointed. Great paddle, very comfortable and much easier paddeling
customer_reviews.author: Jr

customer_reviews.title: Nice size and color
customer_reviews.text: Paddle is well made and easy to use. Light weight and has the caps on the handle to keep the water from dripping onto you as you are paddling in the water
customer_reviews.author: Maggiesport

customer_reviews.title: Well Made Paddle
customer_reviews.text: Very good padding for the handle and breaks down easily for travel. Curved blade takes a bit of getting used to but provides good paddling momentum.
customer_reviews.author: Scar2015

customer_reviews.title: Great oars
customer_reviews.text: We love these oars. They do the job they were designed to do. I would recommend them to anyone who wants a good oar.
customer_reviews.author: LaurenRyszka

customer_reviews.title: Works great.
customer_reviews.text: Nice paddle. Solid, can adjust the paddle angle and comes apart for easy storage.
customer_reviews.author: Rodney Fleming

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great balance and super sturdy for those white water adventures!
customer_reviews.author: Rob Jones

customer_reviews.title: Rusty fasteners.
customer_reviews.text: Working well. A little disappointed in the fastener / button for disassembling the halves rusting already.
customer_reviews.author: Giacamo

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Seems good quality and it is nice that you can store it in two pieces
customer_reviews.author: William Brandt

customer_reviews.title: Best price and paddle around
customer_reviews.text: I have used this paddle twice and it is effortless. Love that I can take it apart and hand one off to my kayak partner.
customer_reviews.author: Handygal

customer_reviews.title: Good paddle. Good price.
customer_reviews.text: Still using it for our kayaks. It's sturdy and easy to snap together. It's not the lightest paddle but the it wasn't expensive either.
customer_reviews.author: Poco

customer_reviews.title: I like that it can be in two pieces for easy ...
customer_reviews.text: The paddle does the job. I like that it can be in two pieces for easy storage.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: great paddle
customer_reviews.text: Great paddle. Fast light. Great price. Bought a second one for our other kayak. Wish they made a longer one
customer_reviews.author: Doug

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: works great, red ends create more visibility on the water
customer_reviews.author: kerry

customer_reviews.title: Nice paddle
customer_reviews.text: This paddle is erfect for the beginning paddler, especially at the great price. It works great and is nice looking too.
customer_reviews.author: Denver

customer_reviews.title: Nice paddles, great price!
customer_reviews.text: These paddles work like a charm with my new Kayak, and they are very lightweight. I like the fact you can take them apart in the middle, which makes them easy to carry around. I think they could be a little longer, but other than that they are a nice product. Plus, the price was much better than my local outdoors store!
customer_reviews.author: Chuck

customer_reviews.title: Great addition to the Airhead when you want to use ...
customer_reviews.text: Great addition to the Airhead when you want to use it in the water in addition to it's ski tube ability.
customer_reviews.author: GP

customer_reviews.title: Cheap but does the job.
customer_reviews.text: Plain and simple: It's a good entry level paddle. I'm not concerned hitting rocks or submerged trees with it. If it does break, it's cheap enough to just buy another one. Maybe some day I would buy a different kind of paddle, but when it comes down to it, it's just a paddle that stores nicely and is something I can use and not be afraid of getting scratched up.
customer_reviews.author: Fake reviews, my account was hacked

customer_reviews.title: good option for the price
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use with an inflatable kayak, and I think it's a good paddle. It's a little heavy, but I'm not going long distances or trying to break any records, so for my use, it's fine. The length is ideal for the wider sides of an inflatable. It's got several click-in settings so you can pick the alignment of your blades. Nice comfy handles and drip guards. For the money, it's a great, sturdy paddle.
customer_reviews.author: ebuyer

customer_reviews.title: great paddle!
customer_reviews.text: Nothing wrong with the product. Good design, quality and I love the two piece construction. Good product for the money.
customer_reviews.author: G. Luker

customer_reviews.title: Airhead kayak paddle
customer_reviews.text: As an avid flatwater paddler for 20 years, I recently upgraded my kayak to a unit that tracks better and is more lightweight. The Airhead looked like a good paddle, and upon first use did not disappoint. The foam grip handles are easy on the hands, it's very light, and the curved blades make for more efficient paddling. The only downside I can note is that there is some minor flexing of the blades when pushing off--they could be more rigid. Overall, however, it's a great paddle and I'd recommend it for recreational paddlers.
customer_reviews.author: 9reedz

customer_reviews.title: Love it !!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 11 year old son to use with his first kayak. Just the right length for him and doesn't seem cheaply made. Have used it several times both he and I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Randy Benton

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy paddle.
customer_reviews.text: Quality 2 pc. paddle. A bit on the heavy side.
customer_reviews.author: Honzo

customer_reviews.title: paddle
customer_reviews.text: I will never be up a creek without this paddle! Very well designed. It is sturdy and very functional. I use it in my kayak as well as a canoe I borrowed. I wouldn't leave home without it.
customer_reviews.author: gregory a page

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Me!
customer_reviews.text: It's perfect for what I need it for. It's also more durable than the other brand I purchased along with this one.
customer_reviews.author: Bomb40

customer_reviews.title: Good paddle/ good value/ well constructed
customer_reviews.text: Very good entry/mid level paddle. Used it and am very pleases with it -Excellent sturdy aluminum construction -Nice padding for grip -3 position Adjustable pin stop to angle the blade at your preferred position Quick shipping/ easy assembly
customer_reviews.author: Walter J Ryszka

customer_reviews.title: Great padded handle
customer_reviews.text: Love it! The padding is great will buy more for my son and daughter. I would requirement this paddle if you are looking for one.
customer_reviews.author: Brenda Bell

customer_reviews.title: nice one
customer_reviews.text: This paddle is a great deal for the price. It is versatile and pretty strong, I abuse this paddle with every use Pushing myself off logs and sandbars etc and its never let me down.
customer_reviews.author: 2x25mpg

customer_reviews.title: Too short for my liking
customer_reviews.text: Paddle too short for my 10' Old Towne fishing kayak.
customer_reviews.author: Gwillie

customer_reviews.title: thank you
customer_reviews.text: this was received quickly and in good condition. was able to put under the tree as the rest of the order was to arrive after christmas..a surprise for my son..he commented that this was better than anyone elses and will know more once the kayak arrives so he is happy
customer_reviews.author: dale

customer_reviews.title: Great Paddle for the Price
customer_reviews.text: This paddle works great for recreational use. I spearfish off of my kayak so I just need a paddle that works and that is exactly what this is.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A great kayak paddle
customer_reviews.text: This is an inexpensive way to replace a worn out or lost paddle. It is durable and just a bit on the heavy side.
customer_reviews.author: jvdavid

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: This paddle is fine if your plan is go paddle around the lake (fresh water only, beyond that it feels cheap and handles cheaply. The connecting point on mine began to corrode after taking it out once into a salt water bay and rinsing it thoroughly with fresh water. I took it out again figuring I could sand and paint over the corrosion if it proved to be good in the surf. It soon failed me as it bent on a bailout without even getting stuck in the sand. Save your money.
customer_reviews.author: IF

customer_reviews.title: Perfect! Can't wait to try it out this weekend
customer_reviews.text: Speedy delivery. Perfect! Can't wait to try it out this weekend!
customer_reviews.author: Naomi L. Bleakley

customer_reviews.title: sturdy
customer_reviews.text: product seems well made and sturdy good for the price i would recomend it to my friends (light and balanced)
customer_reviews.author: Philip Hemmelgarn

customer_reviews.title: Good entry level paddle
customer_reviews.text: This is a fine paddle for an beginner. If you have a wide kayak it may be a little short. The paddle is actually 84" and I don't know why the manufacturer doesn't correct the length they advertise.
customer_reviews.author: Sage Hunter

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Purchased with the Airhead AHTK-1 kayaks, wish they were a little bit longer
customer_reviews.author: NHayes

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Paddle works well--would be better if the length was adjustable.
customer_reviews.author: tim hostettler

customer_reviews.title: best paddle I've ever owned
customer_reviews.text: Easily the best bang for the buck. Works very well and are dang near unbreakable. I've paid more for junk paddles.
customer_reviews.author: chris mcnally

customer_reviews.title: I just loved it.  Just retired and on the river or ocean all the time, The paddle is sturdy and easy to handle.
customer_reviews.text: The only thing that I didn't like was when I got back off the ocean I noticed rust starting around the locking nobb the next day even though I had wash with clean water after getting back.
customer_reviews.author: Lori

customer_reviews.title: Kwik Tek paddle
customer_reviews.text: For the price, I don't think you can beat it this is a great paddle, fairly light and the foam grip on it keeps the blisters at bay. Pretty cool looking too.
customer_reviews.author: Mogley

customer_reviews.title: A solid paddle for the price
customer_reviews.text: Considering this paddle is anywhere from half to a third the price of buying paddles at most sporting goods stores, it's a great value. The lock is firm and it has no problem staying afloat. I'd give it five stars, but I wish the padded handle was a little more padded (though it does serve well in providing extra grip).
customer_reviews.author: Derek Stuhan

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful traction, I love the adjustability from parallel to offset blades; light, inexpensive. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Julia Stavenhagen

product_meta.title: AIRHEAD Kayak Paddle, Deluxe 2 sect, 84", Curved Blade
product_meta.description:
PERFORMANCE KAYAK PADDLE - This 7 foot long kayak paddle breaks down into 2 sections for convenient stowing. You can easily adjust the blade angle for standard or offset paddling. The lightweight and durable aluminum shaft has drip rings and foam hand grips for comfort and to ensure that the paddle will float if dropped. The large ABS blades are curved for greater paddling efficiency.

AMAZON.COM
Need a good kayak paddle but don't have a ton of storage space? Turn to the 7-foot KwikTek AHTK-P2 paddle, which breaks into two sections for easy transport and storage. The paddle offers an adjustable blade angle to accommodate both standard and offset paddling, along with large ABS blades with curved surfaces to promote greater paddling efficiency. And should you run into rough rapids and accidentally drop the paddle, the lightweight, durable aluminum shaft, drip rings, and foam hand grips will keep the paddle afloat until you can retrieve it. Each paddle section measures 49.5 inches long, with an 8.5-inch-wide paddle and a 2-inch diameter. The paddle sections weigh 3 pounds each.
feature_bullets: Breaks into 2 pieces for easy storage and transport
Adjustable blade angle for standard and offset paddling
Curved blade surfaces promote greater paddling efficiency
Lightweight aluminum shaft, drip rings, and foam hand grips

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item is not eligible for international shipping.
